sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"群，帮，伙"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: group, crowd, gang, band, mob, throng, masses, swarm
means: group ： 普通用词，通常指有组织、有秩序的一群人，也可指无意汇集在一起的一群人。
crowd ： 常指无组织地乱哄哄地挤在一起的人群。
gang ： 常指从事非法、暴力或敌对活动的帮派或团伙。有时呈中性，词义同group。
band ： 多指一群有明确宗旨，为共同目的而结合在一起的人，常含贬义。
mob ： 指无组织、乱七八糟凑合在一起的乌合之众，或指聚集在一起寻衅滋事的人群，多为暴徒。
throug ： 书面用词，意义接近crowd，侧重密集地挤在一起的一群，含挤在一起向前推进之意。
masses ： 指群众或人民大众。
swarm ： 指人数众多，杂乱无章，不停移动的一群人。

word_mean: 类，属，组，型，族，群，团：具有若干共同性的物体的集合
化学簇，基：分子中可辨认又常可转移的一群原子
synchronous oocyte development 卵巢内同时存在着2个以上处于不同发育阶段的卵群。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French groupe, from Italian gruppo, of Germanic origin; related to crop

entry.def: A group of people or things is a number of people or things which are together in one place at one time.

example.ex: The trouble involved a small group of football supporters...
example.tran: 这次骚乱涉及一小撮足球迷。

example.ex: The students work in groups on complex problems.
example.tran: 学生们分组研究复杂的问题。

entry.def: A group is a set of people who have the same interests or aims, and who organize themselves to work or act together.

example.ex: Members of an environmental group are staging a protest inside a chemical plant.
example.tran: 一个环保组织的成员正在一家化工厂里举行抗议活动。

entry.tran: （具有共同点而被放在一起考虑的）组，群，类
entry.def: A group is a set of people, organizations, or things which are considered together because they have something in common.

example.ex: She is among the most promising players in her age group...
example.tran: 她是所在年龄组中最有前途的选手之一。

example.ex: As a group, today's  old people are still relatively deprived.
example.tran: 整体而言，当今的老年人依然相对贫困。

entry.def: A group is a number of separate commercial or industrial firms which all have the same owner.

example.ex: The group made a pre-tax profit of £11.05 million.
example.tran: 该集团的税前利润为1,105万英镑。
总部位于法国的保险集团

entry.tran: （尤指流行乐的）乐队,乐团,组合
entry.def: A group is a number of musicians who perform together, especially ones who play popular music.

example.ex: At school he played bass in a pop group called The Urge.
example.tran: 他上学的时候在一个叫“冲动”的流行乐队中担任贝司手。
比利·布拉格的伴奏乐队

entry.def: If a number of things or people are grouped together or group together, they are together in one place or within one organization or system.

example.ex: The fact sheets are grouped into seven sections...
example.tran: 这些资料被分成了7部分。

example.ex: The G-7 organization groups together the world's seven leading industrialized nations...
example.tran: 七国集团将世界上7个最主要的工业国家归在一起。

means.word_mean: 1. any number of entities (members) considered as a unit
2. (chemistry) two or more atoms bound together as a single unit and forming part of a molecule
3. a set that is closed, associative, has an identity element and every element has an inverse
1. arrange into a group or groups;
2. form a group or group together

means.word_mean: 组, 群, 团体, 类, 批, 簇

sentences.en: The research group is ready to start its work.
sentences.cn: 这个研究小组已准备好随时开始工作。

sentences.en: Swallows come by groups at the advent of spring.
sentences.cn: 春天来临时燕子成群飞来。

sentences.en: A large group of chimpanzees was feeding.
sentences.cn: 一大群黑猩猩在吃东西。

sentences.en: A group of us are going up to London for the day.
sentences.cn: 我们有些人要去伦敦一天。

means.word_mean: 小型流行音乐演奏组, （尤指流行音乐的）演奏组, 乐团, 乐队

sentences.en: She is a lead singer in a pop group.
sentences.cn: 她是流行歌曲演唱团体的最重要的歌手。

sentences.en: Please group all those tall flowers here.
sentences.cn: 请把所有高的花放在一起。

sentences.en: Theatres and cinemas were grouped mainly on the two streets.
sentences.cn: 剧院和电影院主要集中在那两条街上。

means.word_mean: 分类; 归类; 将...分组

sentences.en: He grouped students according to ability.
sentences.cn: 他按能力把学生们分类。
